Another good game of the Bioshock Trilogy

这款游戏，在叙事、美术上十分熟练地运用了大量技巧，将浮空的乌托邦哥伦比亚，从市民生活的最细节部分，到宏大的场景表现，事无巨细地表现出来。

[h1]区别于前作的明快画风[/h1]
    本作作为生化奇兵的第三部续作，与前两作形成了十分鲜明的对比。前两作的故事发生在阴暗潮湿的海底城市，突出表现个人主义极端化泛滥化之后的黑暗社会，氛围极其压抑（时不时还有jump scare）。虽然都是反乌托邦主题，无限的故事发生的地点——天空之城哥伦比亚——至少在视觉上就更加明亮而生机勃勃。另一个在风格上的不同体现在社会背景，或者说是故事的主题上。无限有多个小主题，如极端宗教崇拜、剥削劳工、和平与战争的反差、种族与性别歧视，这些主题通过主视角能达到的各种叙事技巧被塞进主角布克、伊丽莎白和哥伦比亚城主康斯托克的主线故事中。

[h1]舞台感强烈的叙事[/h1]
    无限是典型的单线程叙事，舞台的感觉非常明显。即使在单个场景中，只要稍加注意，就能发现游戏总能非常准确地让玩家看到制作组希望他们看到的，整体相连的宏大场景中展示着一个接一个的精美盒子。虽然视角和行动方向的控制权完全交给了玩家，但制作组用了很多技巧来诱导玩家。例如，理论上雕像是突破了空间限制的艺术，游戏中有很多宏大的雕像用于表现有强大压制力的宗教或资本力量。而游戏对于巨大雕像的特定局部的表现非常精细，打光质感和位置十分讲究，让人从某个特定角度能感觉到强烈的威压感或神圣感。游戏十分巧妙地利用了进入该场景前的狭长黑暗的前置通道和门框，来制造一种前后的强烈对比和构图上如同画像般的精致感。为了让玩家到达某个特定位置，光、声音被反复利用。人在潜意识中总是倾向于在黑暗中走向光明，在寂静中关注到细小的声音。在一个线性游戏里这样做显然要比沙盒游戏方便地多，这些技巧也在很多经典中或多或少地出现，但其中“润物细无声”的潜意识的暗示实在让人防不胜防，简直是教科书一般的准确而有效。不过说实话，游戏的美术和音乐风格实在太过出色，即使被牵着鼻子走也心甘情愿。游戏的构图太美了，当走到那个位置的那个瞬间，仿佛是玩家亲手制造了如此美妙的艺术品。也是只有在线性单人游戏中，美术和音乐的表现和时机才能做到如此精细和准确。

[h1]出色的AI[/h1]
    主角的搭档伊丽莎白是一个出色的AI。伊丽莎白在剧情上也是非常重要且特殊的角色，与主角有着非常紧密的联系，同时游戏也试图引起玩家共情，将她与玩家自身也建立强联系。运用的第一个技巧是真实的互动。伊丽莎白能与场景、与玩家发生各种惊喜的互动，她会在某个有趣的地方探头观察，把玩场景中的一些小物件，会躲开玩家的枪口然后指责向她瞄准的行为。在经历过事件后她会与玩家发生讨论甚至争吵，而不是简单机械的你来我往的站桩对话。这一系列复杂的行为让玩家感觉自己面前的不是一串代码，而是一个真实的女孩。第二个技巧是让角色真正有用起来。在整个游玩过程中玩家不需要花费心思去照顾她，反过来她能给你实质的帮助。在战斗中她能在危急的时机提供弹药、医疗、魔药的支援，提示你某个潜在的危险，制造有力的战斗地形和机会。当玩家逐渐习惯了这样有力的支援后，失去她是一个很大的损失一方面。我猜想这就是很多玩家后期剧情中“保护欲”的两个重要来源。另外这个人物在形象设计上也有讲究，可以注意一下她的头身比还有各种展现可爱气质的表情动作，确实非常生动而惹人喜爱。

[h1]快节奏的战斗体验[/h1]
    如上所说，游戏通过各种技巧让视听表现做到最大化，整个游戏在表现严肃社会、哲学思想上的冲击力非常强，同时作为一款第一人称射击游戏，在战斗节奏、武器表现、战场表现上也非常出色。在战斗上节奏张弛有度，战争与和平的对比非常鲜明，这也是另一表现讽刺主题的一个侧面。战斗体验还算丰富，两个阵营的枪械种类众多，为了鼓励玩家使用多种战斗方式，游戏在物品摆放和对玩家行为的预估也十分讲究。例如在大宽度，有高低差的大场景中，在玩家最容易发现的位置放一个闪闪发光的狙击枪；在皮糙肉厚攻击频率超高的敌人“爱国者”附近的平台上放一把火箭筒。当玩家到达该位置时，也差不多是上一次战斗弹药用尽的时机了。

    总的来说，这是一款舞台效果十分强烈的艺术品，稍加思考就能发现制作组在其中加入了大量主视角游戏能做到的增加表现力的、引导玩家的技巧，有序而精确地导向主题的一步步升温。这不算是一款个性突出，风格独特的游戏，留给我们感动之余，这更多是一款技巧的合集，教科书一般值得深度学习的作品。

战斗到后期略显枯燥，但仍然不至于让人觉得无聊。很小的时候就接触小霸王，玩了很多游戏，这游戏PSS上面免费送过，当时因为PS3上没有中文，开了个头就没玩了没有玩下去。这次乘着打折入了这游戏，发现这个游戏完全超出了我的预期。玩了十多二十年的游戏了，现在口味已经很挑了，很少有游戏能够让我沉浸进去体验。但是却是这么一款几年前的游戏，无论是从画面，BGM，NPC互动上，都无可挑剔，堪称惊艳。网上被部分人吐槽的游戏性我也不觉得是问题，我觉得很好玩，这个就仁者见仁了。

如果你是一个单机游戏的爱好者，线性游戏爱好者，剧情党，人设画面党，或者找不到游戏玩了，我推荐你都应该尝试一下这款游戏，我相信你会像我一样，玩完之后点一个推荐。

Don't buy this overhyped game. Here's why:

Bioshock was the spiritual successor to System Shock, a landmark FPS action adventure. Mechanics were streamlined, the scenario, albeit ridiculous, was fresh. I couldn't get over the aesthetics and reduced complexity and so Bioshock 2 was the higlight of the series for me, since it offered an improvement in terms of mechanics and kept what already worked on top of better visuals and level design. Others might stress the clever story of Bioshock 1. 

Now what did the third Shock Revival do in terms of story, worldbuilding and atmosphere? And what about gamplay and mechanics?

BSI is a pretty much an FPS with lots of ballast. It is not an action adventure anymore. You will be shooting at baddies with no options left, most of the time. Surprisingly, and I say this because the press certainly wouldn't tell you, the action is clearly subpar in almost every category. It feels like a late 90s shooter. Shootouts usually occur in giant rectangular places. You can almost win every fight with the criminally dumb ai through conservatively picking them off one after the other. They've reused the regenerating shield popularized by Halo, but here it makes no sense. Every battle follows an astonishing amount of backtracking and browsing. I definitely did not have to comb through so many desks and trashcans in the less action oriented predecessors! 

The "spell" system cannot save the action part from mediocrity. It's mostly differently coloured grenades. There's one redeeming quality with the skyhooking, a system of cruising alongside rails popular in a couple of action games as of late. But you also have to make do with an stale "upgrading" subsystem. Yawn!

Maybe the story could have made BSI an enjoyable ride, but here it fails even harder. What might start promising, as you kindly suspend your disbelief, turns into shocking amounts of narrative garbage.

The first steps are a fun experience as you're pushed headfirst into a weird city in the skies. Without spoiling much, this is another time-travel story with infinite (hence the title) possibilites and every retcon possible at every moment. So don't assume for the story elements to fit together in the end and bring clarity. Same with the background: there's a hamfisted racist angle where the beautiful city is somehow a terrible place for Blacks and the Irish. You hear their lamentations as you're fishing fistfuls of money from a segregated bathroom! Everybody in this super rich place could simply leave at a moment's notice. And the downtrodden seems to be less then animals, as their revolution makes the Haiti uprising look tame in comparison.

The main story makes no sense whatsoever and is a new low in terms of lazy a$$ AAA storytelling. You see the oh so revered "twists" a mile coming, cringing, hoping they won't botch it that bad. But they certainly go the extra mile. Other cheap shocks are simply conjured up when needed even though everything is utterly contradicting. 

My personal theory is that the empowered female is what kept the geeks happy. You can get away with everything these days if you include a damsel that somehow is not a damsel but a strong woman. Movies, comics, books and now computer games. A Mary Sue with Jesus like qualities that make her both vulnerable but perfect for autocastrated boys who want to have permission to worship Iocaste.
Hands down the best story in a video game

Hikayeden başlayalım. Ana karakterimiz Booker Dewitt. Oyun Booker'ın borçlarını ödemek için bir iş alır ve bu işinde Elizabeth adlı bir kızı bulmak vardır ve borçlarını ödemenin tek yolu budur. Booker istemsizce de olsa teklifi kabul eder ve Columbia isimli havada asılı duran adeta cennet misali deyebilceğimiz şehrin yolunu tutar ama bu şehir kendinise peygamber deyen ve şehri kendi istediği gibi yöneten ve bütün insanların ona taptığı bir adam olan ve tabikide baş düşmanımız olan Zachary Comstock'dır. Hikaye aşağı yukarı böyle yani daha fazla şey söylersem spoiler olacağından korktuğum için yeter bu kadar. Biraz karakterleden bahsedeyim ana karakterimiz Booker geçmişinden kaçmak isteyen ama her ne kadar kaçamayıp bunu kabullenmekten başka çaresi olmayan bir tip kendisi sarhoş ve kumara düşkünlüğünden borca batmış tam anlamıyla hayatı bok gibi olan biri aslında. Elizabeth oyunda en sevdiğim karakter olmayı başardı. Hem gücü hem çevikliği hatta Booker'dan daha zeki olması bile yeter de artar ama en güzel tarafı ise savaştayken sandığınızdan daha çok yardım etmesi ben hep Elizabeth'i yük olucak biri olaral gördüm oyunda ama oynadıkça aslında öyle olmadığını gayette kendine bakacak biri olduğunu farkettim. Savaşta olduğumuzda Booker'ın cephanesi bittiğinde veya sağlığı düştüğünde yada tuza ihtiyaç duyduğunda Elizabeth bunları bize sağlıyor. Ara sırada ben etrafı araştırdığımda onunda araştırması ve para getirmesided gayet hoş. En azından savaştayken onun derdine çekmiyoruz bu baya iyi birşey. Comstock başdüşman olucak herhalde bu ne bilim oğlum adamı oyunda en fazla iki sefer gördüm poster heykeller filan hariç onlar her yerde oyunda anca iki sefer değilmi lan tek seferde olabilir bilmiyorum hatırlamıyorum o kadar kötü. Some games leave you feeling empty upon completion; Bioshock Infinite makes you feel fulfilled. You have accomplished what you set out to do, and every cink in the story is finally explained; everything is tied together in a unity not many games accomplish (that is, if you actually understood the story and it's ending). 

The 12 hour story builds up this anticipation; you are guided through the beautiful city of columbia, which at first it bright and vibrant, but gradually shifts to a darker tone as what is really going on is revealed to you. The beggining areas are especially drop-dead gorgeous and still stand up against modern titles released today however, later areas share the same atmoshphere akin to ealier Bioshock games but feel underwhelming in their presentation; I know the game can look great, I just wish this was maintained throughout the game, like why is columbia hidden behind clouds 90% of the time and why is it always night. That is not to say that the same level of detail isn't preserved on all satages however, since every level has secrets scattered all over; from voxophones to posters and displays which gradually explain the back story of different characters and the development and downfall of Columbia. It is good to see this was preserved from the original Bioshock.

This shift in tone is also represented in Infinites combat, where at first you will be fighting small bursts of enemies, to literal armies near the end of the game. Some people have complained that the combat is stale and 'too simple' however, I found it to be engaging and exciting; when you are flying around on the skyline and assassinating enemies from above, before using your vigors to set a swarm of crowns upon that one bullshit Handyman, what isn't to love? Speaking of Handymen, at first they may seem powerful, but once you realise you can use Murder of Crows to stun them, and then just spam Devi'ls Kiss, they go down like a piece of pie. Being the only 'difficult' enemy in the game, it's fair to say Infinite is an easy game. I also wish there wasn't a two weapon limit, since I essentially spent the whole game using the same two weapons (Machine Gun and Sniper Rifle), which pretty much makes the whole upgrade system pointless; why would I upgrade other weapons I would never use? The only reason I even changed loadout was because of a curtain section where Elizabeth is captured and you have to fight swarms of enemies with no ammo (and that fucking jumpscare). After that I went right back to the same loadout, after realising how OP the sniper rifle was; it instakills any enemy apart from patriots and Handymen (with all upgrades), but they go down in like 3 shots anyway. It's just good that the vigors keep combat engaging, and Infinite has a great selection to choose from. You have reincarnations of the original Bioshock's Plasmids, as well as great new additions such as Undertow and Bucking Bronco.

Infinite also puts excessive development on it's character progression, and this is definitely not a bad thing. It was interesting learning how the Letuces (of is it just Letuce?) fit into the story, whilst bringing along a charm of humour, along with the change in Elizabeth, once she understands the truth; shown in her physical change about half was through the game. Infinite returns the use of characters for each level, with the likes of Slate, Fink and Fitzroy who you will encounter within the various stages. I guess if the formula works, why change it.

The general consensus with Infinite is that, while it is curtainly not as good as the first game, I enjoyed learning about the history of Columbia and how DeWitt fits into it's downfall. It's just a shame that the mojoraty of people probably won't understand it's ending, unless they have been keeping track of all the events throughout the game, and spent time exploring every nook and cranny for lore about the world. This would't be so bad if the ending wasn't so damn important, since it literally explains everthing in the game; Why Comstock exists, why Elizabeth exists and why you ended up in Columbia. Any fans of the original Bioshock will definetly enjoy Infinite, just don't expect to be blown away.

I give Bioshock Infinite an 8.8 / 10 with the following categories:
[list]
    [*]Visuals: 9
    [*]Combat: 7.5
    [*]Narrative: 9.6
    [*]Atmosphere: 9.4
    [*]Enjoyment: 9.5 
    [*]Game Integrity: 8 (few bugs present)
[/list]

I have never played any Bioshock title prior to this game, so going in I had no clue what to expect. I expected something decent, but what I got was a masterpiece. 

This game, is hands down, one of the best triple A games I have ever played. 

Let me start out by saying this is the most beautiful world I have ever seen in a video game. The art style is absolutely phenomenal. The light effects are gorgeous. The setting is simply breathtaking. I spent much of my time in Columbia walking around just admiring the city. 

The music is also top notch, featuring many songs from the 30s, 40s, and 50s. The effects sound superb, and the score itself is very pleasing to the ear with sensational orchestral piano and violin.

The gameplay is incredibly addictive between jumping from skyline to skyline with strikes, and between mixing up vigor usage there is a large amount of variety and combinations to be had here. And that's not even including the gunplay, which is also fantastic. 

The story is magnificent. When the game ended I couldn't even belive it. I was stunned. I was shocked. I was so impressed, and so dazzled by the sheer immensity of the tale told, that I was astonished. 

Honestly my only regret is that I didn't play this game sooner. It's a 10/10.

You will not regret this purchase I guarentee it.

Bardzo dobra gra, ale jak dla mnie dwie poprzednie części Bioshock były lepsze. Dużym plusem jest ogólnie rozgrywka i zakręcona fabuła. Plusem jest możliwość noszenia dużej ilości gotówki zamiast posiadania ograniczonej pojemności portfela jak w poprzednich częściach. Wstęgi są ciekawym dodatkiem, ale np. haki już czasem się bugują i wskakując na nie możesz od razu się przekręcić w jedną stronę, a w drugą nie. Na maksymalnych ustawieniach graficznych gra działa dobrze, ale cienie trzeba zmienić na średnie, bo inaczej w dziwny sposób się rysują i wyglądają inaczej jak jesteśmy od nich dalej a inaczej jak bliżej. Znaczącym błędem w ostatniej części gry (na maksymalnych ustawieniach) jest też to, że wsiadając do windy z Elizabeth w Comstock House, aby zakończyć rozdział gra potrafi nie wczytać następnego rozdziału lub wczytać, że jesteśmy pod podłogą i umieramy lub, że słyszymy tylko odgłos zniszczenia naszej tarczy i nic się nie dzieje i aby grać dalej trzeba przestawić ustawienia na średnie i odpalić grę w oknie i powtórzyć rozgrywkę od ostatniego zapisu. Co do wad w samej rozgrywce to możemy nosić tylko 2 bronie na raz i nie mają one różnych typów amunicji w przeciwieństwie do poprzednich części kiedy nosiliśmy wszystkie bronie i każda miała 3 typy amunicji więc musieliśmy lepiej gospodarować zasobami czy nawet zastawiać pułapki. Brak jakiegokolwiek systemu badania wrogów obecnego w poprzednich 2 grach też jest dla mnie minusem. Brak możliwości noszenia z sobą apteczek i buteleczek też uznaję za minus. Wprowadzenie autozapisu i usunięcie możliwości zapisu ręcznego to dla mnie też minus. Osobiście wolałem zdobywać EVE w poprzednich częściach i za EVE ulepszać Plasmids niż jak tutaj ulepszać Vigors za gotówkę. Wolałem też za EVE kupować Gene Tonics i móc nosić ich wiele w zależności od mojego stylu gry i potrzeb niż jak tutaj używać na raz tylko 4 części ubrań dających pasywne zdolności. Minusem jest dla mnie też to, że ulepszenia do broni kupujemy za gotówkę w automatach, bo lepszym rozwiązaniem było zdobywanie ulepszeń do broni w specjalnych maszynach w poprzednich grach. Dużym minusem dla mnie jest to, żę gra w przeciwieństwie do poprzednich 2 części nie daje nam żadnych wyborów, które wpływają na zakończenie przez co zakończenie jest tylko jedno i nawet wymordowanie neutralnych NPC nie ma na nie wpływu.

Ogólnie bardzo dobra gra, ale jak dla mnie najsłabszy Bioshock.
